A C D I P R S T X Y

A

addEventListener(Object) - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Pointer
Tell this pointer to send pointer events to the provided Object.
angle() - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Pointer
Returns the current angle of the device driving this Pointer in degrees.
angleDelta(float) - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Pointer
Returns the change in angle since the last move.
awaitImages(String) - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Substrate
Spawns a thread that waits for images in a pool.

C

com.oblong.gspeak - package com.oblong.gspeak
The substrate library provides users with an API for building multi-user, gestural interactions in Processing driven by pointing devices such as mobile phones with motion sensing hardware.

D

depositImage(String) - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Substrate
Deposits the current frame in a pool.
depositImage(PImage, String) - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Substrate
Deposits an image into a pool.
depositProtein(Protein, String) - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Substrate
non-throwing method for depositing proteins
dispose() - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Substrate
Clean up after ourselves when our PApplet is ready.
draw() - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Pointer
Draw a basic indicator for the phone pointer: a circle around its x, y location.
draw() - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Substrate
Polls the remote pool to see if any new proteins have arrived; handles them and creates and manages Pointer instances.
drawPointers() - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Substrate
Draw all the pointers we're currently aware of.

I

isSoft() - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Pointer
Input agnostic way to describe if the Pointer is not in an active state: for a mouse, "soft" would be the equivalent of saying no buttons are pressed.

P

pAngle() - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Pointer
Returns the previous angle of the device driving this Pointer in degrees.
Pointer - Class in com.oblong.gspeak
Class representing a single connected device, and its current pointing state: for example, its location, angle, swipe state.
pointers - Variable in class com.oblong.gspeak.Substrate
A map of device names to their Pointer abstractions.
post() - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Substrate
Updates when we last saw each pointer.
pre() - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Substrate
Hand out any images we've loaded before the draw loop.
provenance() - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Pointer
Returns the name of the device driving the Pointer, also known as its Provenance.
px() - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Pointer
Returns the previous x position.
py() - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Pointer
Returns the previous y position.

R

rawAngleDelta() - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Pointer
Returns the absolute difference between the last two rotation values.
removeEventListener(Object) - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Pointer
Stop sending pointer event messages to a listener.
requestImage(String) - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Substrate
Sends a message to the device powering the given Pointer that the application would like to receive an image from the Pointer.
requestImage(Pointer) - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Substrate
Sends a message to the device powering the given Pointer that the application would like to receive an image from the Pointer.
reset() - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Pointer
Resets the Pointer to be in the center of the sketch and its angle to 0.

S

Substrate - Class in com.oblong.gspeak
Your basic library object that sets up a server for communicating with pointing devices and parses incoming data from those devices.
Substrate(PApplet, boolean) - Constructor for class com.oblong.gspeak.Substrate
Creates an object that listens for events and parses data from a remote set of pointing devices, but only creates a data server if run_tcp_server is true and there isn't already one running.
Substrate(PApplet) - Constructor for class com.oblong.gspeak.Substrate
Our default constructor creates an object that listens for events and parses data from a remote set of pointing devices, starts a server to listen for the events on port 65456, and creates the Pools (data resources) needed for the pointing device to send data if they do not already exist.
Substrate(PApplet, String) - Constructor for class com.oblong.gspeak.Substrate
Creates an object that listens for events and parses data from a remote set of pointing devices.

T

toSlaw(PImage) - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Substrate
Returns a PImage as Slaw.
toSlaw(PImage, String) - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Substrate
Returns a PImage as Slaw, suitable for depositing in a Pool.

X

x() - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Pointer
Returns the x position of the pointer on screen (or perhaps, slightly offscreen -- the coordinates are not bound to the screen).

Y

y() - Method in class com.oblong.gspeak.Pointer
Returns the y position of the pointer on screen (or perhaps, slightly offscreen -- the coordinates are not bound to the screen).
